coded_answer.p: To the manager of The Circle Theatre!

I have been recentlyrecently been into London and I've seenI saw the artshow "Over Thethe Rainbow" at The Circle Theatre. I have to say that it was a very disappointing evening for me. It should starthave started at 19.30 and it hadstarted at 20:15! There were no discounts available and the theatre's restaurant was closed. But the worst thing inabout "London's newest and best musical show", as you called it, was the abscentnessabsence of Danny Brook. The actor wichwhichwho was "dancing" was horrible. He had beenwas mistakeingmistakingmaking mistakes all the time. AtIn the advertisement, thereit was written "your perfect evening out". Well, it wasn't perfect! I want you to give me back my money,. I hope that in future you will corectcorrect all thisthese mistakes.

Unfortunately, Pat wasn't very good at keeping secrets. I told him my worst love story. One day, I was going to school by bus and - I don't know why - I went to the end of it. I looked up and I saw her, standing next to me with her friend. Every time when I looked up at her my legs were shaking so I couldn't comeget up and talk to her! But with help from my friend, who convinced me to do this, I've metI met her. Her name was Sue and she was so beautiful that I still can't find words which could be good to describe her. I was constantly seeing her but my shyness made my mouth close so I couldn't say anything! I was in Love but that wasn't nice. FewA few days later someone told me that Sue was actually a boy! That was supposed to be a joke from my "coleaguescolleagues"! From that moment I feelfelt like I havehad been in front of a video camera and the operator of it iswas me! I couldn't speak to anyone. The worst thing in this story is, that Pat told this to everyone at school. From that moment I livehave lived alone. Thanks to Pat.
